column4: I don't really know what Ubuntu's goals are. Frankly, I don't care that much.  Right now it works well for me.  I think you're right if the goal is to take over most of Windows' market share, but I'm not sure that's the goal (or necessarily possible).
I also think that there isn't a "point of Linux" per se, other than to be useful.  The great think about free software is that different groups can decide what "useful" means to them.

So, if you have a directory DIR, DIR/FOLDER is a subdirectory.  What is the term for DIR/FOLDER/OTHERFOLDER?  In other words, what's the term for all directories that are under DIR?  Is it also subdirectory, or does that only refer to the first tier?
Ok.  Just sort of realized I didn't know for sure.  :-)
a mix of sarge and sid (moreso the latter) with syncs and merges
many ubuntu packages have a full life of their own after merging
But outside of the ubuntu packages, universe is basically a frozen snapshot of sid, right?
Ah so universe = sid main, and multiverse = sid non-free?
it's highly recommended that you dist-upgrade to hoary directly if you wish to use the latest packages.
using backports often gets one into a bind because the packages are versioned poorly, so dist-upgrades cause headaches
Yeah, but generally I don't care about using the latest versions.  I'd rather few downloads and more stability.  There are only one or two apps I want the most current versions of, like firefox.
all right, but do keep in mind the backports'-broken-versioning caveat if you plan to dist-upgrade to hoary.
